page.title: 03Transport
page.content:
There is one bus service in the village which runs between Brandsby and York via Crayke and Easingwold. It makes three trips. one early morning, dinner time and evening. Most people in Crayke need a car to get to work and to the shops. A very small proportion use motor bikes, pedal cycle or walk
The roads are very narrow and twisted and Crayke is on a main route to Malton and Helmsley which is on the way to the east coast.
It isn't difficult to walk to the nearest town of Easingwolds which is two miles away as it is downhill, but coming back the walk is difficult as the hill is steep
